identificationModule.briefTitle: Homoarginine Supplementation in Patients After Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study represents a follow-up of the previous study "Single and Multiple Doses of an Oral Formulation of L-Homoarginine in Healthy Human Subjects" (NCT02675660). This study will evaluate the applicability of an oral formulation of L-homoarginine to normalize homoarginine blood levels in patients with acute ischemic stroke.

armGroups.label: placebo
armGroups.description: placebo capsules containing lactose - oral once weekly administration for six month

armGroups.label: homoarginine
armGroups.description: 125 mg L-homoarginine supplement - oral once weekly administration for six month

primaryOutcomes.description: Normalization of homoarginine serum concentration to levels \>2.1 umol/L.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Intima-media thickness (IMT) measured at both common carotid arteries using an edge detection system. Plaques are defined as protrusion of ≥1.5 mm in common, internal and external carotid artery.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS) will be assessed by a neurologist. The NIHSS is composed of 11 items, each of which scores a specific ability between a 0 (normal) and 4 (maximum impairment). The maximum possible score is 42, with the minimum score being a 0.
Modified Ranking Scale (mRS) is a scale for measuring the degree of disability of a stroke patients. The scale runs from 0 (perfect health) to 6 (death).

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* ischemic stroke (CT or MRI), high-risk transient ischemic attack (ABCD2-score \>= 4) or acute central retinal artery occlusion
* serum homoarginine \</= 2.1 umol/L
* signed informed consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* no acute stroke
* serum homoarginine \> 2.1 umol/L
* heart failure (NYHA \> 1)
* chronic kidney disease (GFR \<60 mL/min)
* not competent
* pregnancy, lactation
* no or withdrawn signed informed consent
